body.name: ARDIYES RX 580 Graphic Cards (with ARGB Fans), 2048SP, 8GB, GDDR5, 256 Bit, Pc Gaming Video Card, 2XDP, HDMI, PCI Express 3.0 with Freeze Fan Stop for Desktop Computer Gaming Gpu
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 39 mins
features: 【Acrctic Islands architecture and Superior Gaminig Experience】 RX 580 8G is a mainstream gaming GPU built on the 14 nm process and based on the Polaris 20 graphics processor, in its Polaris 20 XTX variant,the video card supports DirectX 12. This ensures that all modern games will run on this RX 580. The gpu has equipped with 2048SP and 8GB GDDR5 memory with a 1750 MHz (8 GB), features to deliver the fastest, smoothest, most power-efficient gaming experiences for computer users.

【Multiple Interfaces and High Defination】The 580 graphic card has 3 monitor support ouput included 2X DisplayPort 1.4a. +1X HDMI 2.0b. RX 580 is connected to the rest of the system using a PCI-Express 3.0 x16 interface which has higher resolution,show more character action details and clearer image quality, supports up to 8K display, delivers more higher definition pc gaming effect and experience.

【Outstanding Heat Dissipation】Composite heat pipes of this 580 8g can directly and greatly contact the GPU core in order to quickly export the core heat, avoiding the problems such as GPU full load frequency reduction and improving the stability and life of long-term use.

【Low Consumption and Independently Powered】Being a dual-slot card, the RX 580 draws power from 1x 8-pin power connector, with power draw rated at 185 W maximum.If you have any questions about the product, please contact seller support.

【low noise and Durable】This rx 580 8g pc gaming video card has semi-automatic intelligent fans system, which can automatically sense the GPU temperature. When the GPU temperature is low or under low load, the fans will automatically stop running, providing a comfortable office experience with zero noise and extended service life of this 8g graphic cards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value card for 2024
reviews.reviewText: First off, here's some brief context:A brief history of the 2048SP 580 models - AMD released them to Chinese markets, and they're basically an RX 570 with 8GB and negligible chip differences.Brief AMD history on these cards: When it initially came out, the 570 and 580 were negligibly close in performance for the most part, especially in esports titles. They both held up well even through the 5500XT-6500XT eras and against their main rival from NVIDIA the 1060. Only since the 7600/3050 cards were any real improvements offered in this middle area segment.Inside of the box, it comes with the graphics card, a USB stick with driver software, and Molex power connector. It's recommended to just use the VGA/PCIE plug that your power supply comes with, or if your computer did not come with any like a prebuilt might not have then just to purchase a 3rd party one from a reputable cable brand (the ones that do those braided/colored cables are always a safe bet). AMD recommends a 450W PSU, but if you know how to undervolt and have a low powered system then you can get by with less.The card itself works fine, it shifts through a preset of colors and the performance meets expectations. It didn't get too loud for me which is nice. It's also recommended to just use the AMD driver since the software on the USB is outdated. The card size works for mATX sized systems and just fits barely in my case (Fractal Core 1100).So why is this card still good in 2024? Because esports level cards of current generations cost more. The amount of games this can run for the price is pretty insane. On average, the current generation of upgrades costs double the price for less than double the performance. If you're running anything up to 2023, this is a good card to use for 1080p.Why 2023? The only downside to consider in my opinion is that AMD is removing non-security support from it, so future drivers won't optimize the 500 series for newer games anymore. That's perfectly fine for me though and that it still has any driver support at all still is pretty great. I'm very satisfied with the ARDIYES and do recommend it if you fall into any of the categories where this card makes sense for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Save your money
reviews.reviewText: The card did not perform as expected and has failed after 5 months of light use. Save your money.
